snippet: Gilt Moroccan Steakhouse and Lounge, which opened in February, has a menu that mixes modern Moroccan fare with a some traditional steakhouse offerings.
abstract: Stephanie Lyness reviews Gilt Moroccan Steakhouse and Lounge in New Haven (Metropolitan/Connecticut). Photos (M)
lead_paragraph: WITH spring temperatures regularly hitting the 70s, one of the best places to eat in downtown New Haven is the roof deck at 266 College Street. Until this year, that would have been Bespoke, a contemporary Mediterranean restaurant. But this spring, you'll be eating mezze at its new incarnation, Gilt Moroccan Steakhouse and Lounge. Gilt's chef and owner, Lauren Kendzierski, bought Bespoke in 2010 from New Haven restaurateurs Arturo and Suzette Franco-Comacho. She reopened it in February as Gilt, serving what she described, in a recent phone conversation, as modern Moroccan cuisine.
